com.genband.kandy.api.services.push

Interface IKandyPushService


  • public interface IKandyPushService
    This interface is used to handle push credentials, events and notifications.

    Push notifications let your application receive events, even when the user is not actively using your application. On Android devices, when a device receives a push notification, your application's icon and a message appear in the status bar. When the user taps the notification, they are sent to your application.

    The Kandy SDK provides push notifications using Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) if possible. On devices that do not support GCM, Kandy will use a background service that maintains a persistent connection to the Kandy Cloud to deliver pushes.

    Configure

    • Receivers & Services

      To use push notifications, your application must register the following service and broadcast receivers. Add the following XML to your AndroidManifest.xml file immediately before the closing </application> tag: 

      
 <receiver
        android:name="com.genband.kandy.api.services.push.KandyGCMPushReceiver"
        android:permission="com.google.android.c2dm.permission.SEND" >
        <intent-filter>
        <action android:name="com.google.android.c2dm.intent.RECEIVE" />
        <action android:name="com.google.android.c2dm.intent.REGISTRATION" />
        <category android:name="com.kandy.sampleapp" />
        </intent-filter>
 </receiver>
 <service
        android:name="com.genband.kandy.api.services.push.KandyGCMPushService"
        android:enabled="true" />

      If you modify the package name of the tutorial app, change the android:name attribute of <category> element above to match your application's package name. If you choose to subclass KandyGCMPushReceiver, change com.genband.kandy.services.push.model.KandyGCMPushReceiver above to your class name.

    • Permissions

      Your application must also have the permissions needed to receive pushes and show notifications. Make sure that these permissions are present in your AndroidManifest.xml file, typically immediately before the <application> tag: 

      
 <permission
        android:name="com.kandy.sampleapp.permission.C2D_MESSAGE"
        android:protectionLevel="signature" />
 <uses-permission android:name="com.kandy.sampleapp.permission.C2D_MESSAGE" />
 <uses-permission android:name="com.google.android.c2dm.permission.RECEIVE" />

      If you modify the package name of the tutorial app, change the android:name attribute in the last two lines of the snippet above to match your application's package name.

    • Notification icon

    Enable

    Your device needs to register itself for push notifications.

    To enable your device for push: 

    
 Kandy.getServices().getPushService().enablePushNotification(new KandyResponseListener() {
        
        @Override
        public void onRequestFailed(int responseCode, String err) {
                //TODO insert your code here
        }
 
        @Override
        public void onRequestSucceded() {
                //TODO insert your code here
        }
 });

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disablePushNotification(KandyResponseListener listener)
      Stop receiving push events
      void enablePushNotification(String registrationId, KandyResponseListener listener)
      Start receiving push notifications.
      void handlePushNotification(Context context, Intent intent, KandyResponseListener listener)

    • Method Detail

      • enablePushNotification

        void enablePushNotification(String registrationId,
                            KandyResponseListener listener)
        Start receiving push notifications.

        The received events will be triggered thru KandyEventsCoreService . make sure the register a listener with KandyEventsCoreService#registerServiceNotificationsListener(KandyEventsServiceNotificationListener)
        Note:
        Must be called after successfully login.

        Parameters:
        registrationId - token for the push notification must be passed to Kandy for registartion on Kandy Push Notifications
        listener - Listener which handles the response of the operation

      • handlePushNotification

        void handlePushNotification(Context context,
                            Intent intent,
                            KandyResponseListener listener)
        Handle the Kandy push notification
        Parameters:
        context -
        intent - with Kandy Push Notification data to be handled
        listener - - KandyResponseListener which handles the response of the operationListener which handles the response of the operation

      • disablePushNotification

        void disablePushNotification(KandyResponseListener listener)
        Stop receiving push events
